components.name: home_jumbotron
components.title: Domoticasite
components.text:
Web Application for home automation, the main function are:
- Programmable thermostat
- Display environmental temperature and humidity in real-time
- Comparison between energy power generated by photovoltaic system and power consumed in the home.

It is a IOT (Internet of things) solution, implemented on Raspberry 2, with the use of Wi-Fi sensor. The Web application is implemented with Meteor-Kitchen.

components.name: getting_stater
components.source:
![alt-text-1](/images/meteor-icon.png)![alt-text-2](/images/highchart-icon.png)![alt-text-3](/images/rasp-icon.png)![alt-text-4](/images/esp8266-icon.png)![alt-text-5](/images/meteor-kitchen-icon.png)

### Domoticasite Web Application for home automation, the main function are: - Programmable thermostat - Display environmental temperature and humidity in real-time - Comparison between energy power generated by photovoltaic system and power consumed in the home. It is a IOT (Internet of things) solution, implemented on Raspberry, with the use of Wi-Fi sensors. The Web application is implemented with Meteor-Kitchen. The project is an evolution of previous abandoned personal projects. ### Software: - Meteor (with meteor-kitchen) - Highcharts library - Apache2 (configured with proxypass) - EspEasy (firmware for ESP8266) ### Hardware: - Server Web: Raspberry Pi2 Model B - WiFi Module: ESP8266 - Sensors: DHT22 or Photoresistor

components.name: build_update
components.source:
### Prepared Windows development enviroment

The Domoticasite was created with meteor-kitchen (http://www.meteorkitchen.com)

* Because of meteor-kitchen doesn't work on Raspberry you have compile the Domoticasite on other systems, for example on Windows.
* Download and install last version of node.
* Install npm for windows
* npm install --global --production windows-build-tools
* Download and install last version of meteor.
* Download and install last version of meteor-kitchen.


### Quickly  
meteor-kitchen ./Domoticasite.json ./Domoticasite --meteor-release 1.5.2.2
cd ./Domoticasite
meteor build --architecture=os.linux.x86_64


### Scripts for Windows enviroment
Scripts useful in order to build, upload and restart Domoticasite


#### Build.bat
    @echo off
    echo BUILD
    SET dir1=%~dp0
    del /Q "%dir1%"\Domoticasite.json
    curl https://www.meteorkitchen.com/api/getapp/json/N526wRpB3xekvDM5M -o %dir1%\Domoticasite.json
    rmdir bundle /S /Q
    mkdir emptyfolder
    robocopy emptyfolder bundle /purge
    rmdir emptyfolder
    rmdir bundle 
    rmdir Domoticasite /S /Q
    mkdir Domoticasite
    meteor-kitchen %dir1%\Domoticasite.json %dir1%\Domoticasite --meteor-release 1.5.4
    cd ./Domoticasite
    meteor build --architecture=os.linux.x86_64 --directory %dir1% & cd %dir1%


#### Upload.bat
    pscp.exe -pw sonia123 -C -r bundle pi@192.168.1.132:/tmp
    pscp.exe -pw sonia123 -C files/deploy.sh pi@192.168.1.132:/tmp
    plink.exe -ssh -pw sonia123 -batch pi@192.168.1.132 chmod +x /tmp/deploy.sh;/tmp/deploy.sh;/bin/bash


#### files/Deploy.sh
    #!/bin/bash
    PATH=/home/pi/.nvm/versions/node/v4.8.6/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/local/games:/usr/games
    echo $(date) | tee /tmp/deploy.log
    forever stopall
    rm -rf ~/Domoticasite
    echo " Moving bundle to /home/pi/Domoticasite..."
    cp -r /tmp/bundle ~/Domoticasite
    rm ~/.forever/*.log
    cd ~/Domoticasite/programs/server
    meteor npm install --save node-gyp@3.6.0
    meteor npm install --save node-pre-gyp@0.6.34
    meteor npm install
    meteor npm install --save wiringpi-node
    meteor npm install --save git+https://github.com/HardwareProjects/node-dht-sensor.git
    cd ~/Domoticasite
    forever start main.js

components.name: install_letsencrypt
components.source:
#### Install Letsencrypt

    sudo apt-get install python-certbot-apache
    sudo certbot --apache

https://pimylifeup.com/raspberry-pi-ssl-lets-encrypt/


### Renew certificate every 90 days

There are problems with sslh to automatically renew the certificate, see:

https://github.com/certbot/certbot/issues/341 


So, mannualy make these commands:

    modify /etc/apache2/site
    modify /etc/apache2/site-enables/defaul.conf 4443 --> 433
    sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 stop
    sudo ./letsencrypt-auto certonly --standalone --email mtt_stt@yahoo.it -d matteosetti.noip.me

components.name: install_dump1090_mutability
components.source:
### Install dump1090-mutability
Prerequisited: Apache 2.4

Instructions:
    * sudo apt-get install libusb-1.0-0-dev librtlsdr-dev
    * sudo wget https://github.com/mutability/dump1090/releases/download/v1.14/dump1090-mutability_1.14_armhf.deb
    * Make /etc/modprobe.d/raspi-blacklist.conf
        blacklist dvb_usb_rtl28xxu 
        blacklist rtl2832 
        blacklist rtl2830

Links:
* _http://podtynnyi.com/2015/10/11/installing-rtlsdr-on-raspberry-pi-2/_
* _https://blackswan.ch/archives/567_
* _https://forum.planefinder.net/threads/raspberry-pi-b-rpi2-rpi3-installation-instructions-for-raspbian-dump1090-data feeder.241/_



### Configure dump1090-mutability

https://www.kevinhooke.com/2014/07/26/installing-rtl-sdr-and-dump1090-on-a-raspberry-pi-to-receive-ads-b-signals/


### Configuration dump1090-mutability

Add the following lines in /mods-enables/alias.conf:

    Alias "/data" "/run/dump1090-mutability"
    <Directory "/run/dump1090-mutability">
          Require all granted
    </Directory>

    Alias "/dump1090" "/usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html"
    <Directory "/usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html">
           Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews
           AllowOverride None
           Require all granted
           DirectoryIndex gmap.html
    </Directory>
    


### Modify line of this file /usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html/gmapl.html
From
	<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://code.jquery.com/ui/1.10.3/themes/smoothness/jquery-ui.css" />
    
    <form id="airframes_post" method="POST" action="http://www.airframes.org/" target="_blank" class="hidden">


to:
	<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://code.jquery.com/ui/1.10.3/themes/smoothness/jquery-ui.css" />
	
    <form id="airframes_post" method="POST" action="https://www.airframes.org/" target="_blank" class="hidden">

components.name: install_markdown
components.source:
## Prepare Rasperry enviroment
With the following instructions you will be able prepare Raspberry the first time.



### Install NVM

    curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.33.6/install.sh | bash
    

Install last version of node:

    nvm install 4.8.6 		node v.4.8.4 is the node version used by Meteor 1.5.4
    nvm alias default 4.8.6		
    
    
Link node & npm

	sudo rm /usr/bin/node
    sudo rm /usr/bin/npm
	sudo ln -s /home/pi/.nvm/versions/node/v4.8.6/bin/node  /sbin/node
	sudo ln -s /home/pi/.nvm/versions/node/v4.8.6/bin/npm  /sbin/npm

    
    
Note, useful command:
    nvm install <version>       Download and install a <version>   
    nvm install stable			Install last version of node
    nvm alias default <version>	Change default for every session
    nvm use <version>           Modify PATH to use <version>
    nvm ls                      List versions (installed versions are blue)


#### Install NPM (optional)
Optional because of we use NPM library installed with NVM
  

	sudo apt-get install npm
    

Install npm version (4.6.1) compatible with Meteor 1.5.4
    
    npm install -g npm@x.x.x


#### Install GIT

    sudo apt-get install git


#### Install Meteor 1.5.4

	cd /home/pi
    git clone -b "1.5.4" https://github.com/mttstt/meteor.git
    cd meteor ./scripts/generate-dev-bundle.sh > out.log 2>&1 &
    ./meteor > out2.log 2>&1 &

    

Link meteor

	sudo ln -s /home/pi/meteor/meteor /sbin/meteor


Check installed version:

    meteor --version
    meteor node -v
    meteor npm -v


### Install Forever
To start mongodb at boot
Forever is an useful command to lanch programs
	  
    sudo npm install -g forever


Note, useful commands:
	forever start Domoticasite/main.js 	In order to start job
    forever stop Domoticasite/main.js		In order to stop job


### Install forever-service

	npm install -g forever-service

	sudo /home/pi/.nvm/versions/node/v4.8.6/bin/forever-service install Domoticasite --script main.js -e "PORT=3000 MONGO_URL=mongodb://localhost/Domoticasite ROOT_URL=https://matteosetti.noip.me"
   

#### Configure Wiring
Apply the following instructions in order to avoid use root account for wi-wiring:

    http://wiringpi.com/wiringpi-update-to-2-29/    


#### Configure /etc/enviroment
Add the following lines in /etc/enviroment

    export WIRINGPI_GPIOMEM=1
    PORT=3000
    MONGO_URL=mongodb://localhost/Domoticasite
    ROOT_URL=https://matteosetti.noip.me


#### Google credentials
In order use google autentication, update the URI redirection in https://console.developers.google.com

Then, create the following file in /home/pi/production-settings.json

    {"oauth": {
       "google": {"clientId": "XXX.apps.googleusercontent.com","secret": "XXX"}        
       }
    }


#### Create the new file file /etc/profile.d/METEOR_SETTINGS.sh
This is requested because production meteor app don't use --settings parameter. 

    export METEOR_SETTINGS=$(cat /home/pi/production-settings.json)


### /etc/defaults/rcS

Configure:
	FSCKFIX=yes

Note:
	sudo fdisk -l
    umount /dev/sd?
	sudo fsck.ext4 -cDfty -C 0 /dev/sdb*

components.name: 123_solar
components.source:
### Instruction install 123Solar (in Italian language)

http://www.flanesi.it/doku/doku.php?id=123solar_mono_powerone_jessie


Starting service ad boot:

	cd /etc/systemd/system
    
	sudo chmod a+x 123solar.service
    
    sudo systemctl enable 123solar.service

components.name: sslh
mongodb
components.source:
### Install mongodb
In production eviroment you have install a dedicate server mongodb.
  
    sudo apt-get install mongodb-server

Note: The last version of mongodb running on raspberry is 2.4.6, because of raspberry is a 32-bit OS on ARM cpu. Raspberry Pi-2 has ARM7 but Raspian OS is compiled for ARM6.


To start mongodb at boot

	update-rc.d mongodb defaults


### Upgrade mongodb (optional) 
Download Mongodb Version 3.0.14: 
	wget http://andyfelong.com/downloads/mongodb_stretch_3_0_14_core.zip
	wget http://andyfelong.com/downloads/tools_mongodb_3_0_14.tar.gz


Copy mongodb core files (mongo, mongos, mongos) to /usr/bin.
    

Modify /lib/systemd/system/mongodb.service
    [Unit]
	Description=An object/document-oriented database
	Documentation=man:mongod(1)
	After=network.target

	[Service]
	User=mongodb
	ExecStart=/usr/bin/mongod --config /etc/mongodb.conf
	
	[Install]
	WantedBy=multi-user.target


Useful notes:
	sudo systemctl stop mongodb.service
	sudo systemctl daemon-reload
	sudo systemctl start mongodb.service

components.name: config_apache2_mkdown
components.source:
Apache > 2.4.10


### Install Apache modules

    sudo a2enmod proxy proxy_connect rewrite headers proxy_http proxy_wstunnel


### Configure /etc/apache2/sites-enables/matteosetti.noip.me.conf

	<VirtualHost *:4443>
         		ServerName matteosetti.noip.me
                ServerAdmin mtt_stt@yahoo.it

                SSLEngine on
                SSLProxyEngine On
                ProxyRequests Off

                SSLCertificateFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/matteosetti.noip.me/cert.pem
                SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/matteosetti.noip.me/privkey.pem
                SSLCertificateChainFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/matteosetti.noip.me/chain.pem
                SSLCACertificatePath /etc/ssl/certs/

                DocumentRoot /var/www

                ProxyPass /123solar http://localhost/123solar
                ProxyPassReverse /123solar http://localhost/123solar

                # ProxyPass /dump1090/ http://localhost/dump1090/
                # ProxyPassReverse /dump1090/ http://localhost/dump1090/

                ProxyPass /dump1090/ http://localhost:1090/
                ProxyPassReverse /dump1090/ http://localhost:1090/


                ProxyPass /webcam http://192.168.1.104:88/
                ProxyPassReverse /webcam http://192.168.1.104:88/

                ProxyPass / http://localhost:3000/
                ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:3000/

                RewriteEngine on
                RewriteCond %{HTTP:UPGRADE} ^WebSocket$ [NC]
                RewriteCond %{HTTP:CONNECTION} ^Upgrade$ [NC]
                RewriteRule .* ws://localhost:3000%{REQUEST_URI} [P]

                BrowserMatch "MSIE [2-6]" \
                nokeepalive ssl-unclean-shutdown \
                downgrade-1.0 force-response-1.0
                # MSIE 7 and newer should be able to use keepalive
                BrowserMatch "MSIE [17-9]" ssl-unclean-shutdown
 	</VirtualHost>



### Configure /etc/apache2/ports.conf

    # If you just change the port or add more ports here, you will likely also
    # have to change the VirtualHost statement in
    # /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default.conf
    Listen 80
    <IfModule ssl_module>
      	    Listen 4443
    </IfModule>
    <IfModule mod_gnutls.c>
	    Listen 4443
    </IfModule>
    # vim: syntax=apache ts=4 sw=4 sts=4 sr noet



### Configure /etc/apache2/mods-enabledalias.conf


	<IfModule alias_module>
        # Aliases: Add here as many aliases as you need (with no limit). The format is
        # Alias fakename realname
        #
        # Note that if you include a trailing / on fakename then the server will
        # require it to be present in the URL.  So "/icons" isn't aliased in this
        # example, only "/icons/".  If the fakename is slash-terminated, then the
        # realname must also be slash terminated, and if the fakename omits the
        # trailing slash, the realname must also omit it.
        #
        # We include the /icons/ alias for FancyIndexed directory listings.  If
        # you do not use FancyIndexing, you may comment this out.

        Alias /icons/ "/usr/share/apache2/icons/"

        <Directory "/usr/share/apache2/icons">
                Options FollowSymlinks
                AllowOverride None
                Require all granted
        </Directory>


        Alias "/data" "/run/dump1090-mutability"
        <Directory "/run/dump1090-mutability">
                Require all granted
        </Directory>

        Alias "/dump1090" "/usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html"
        <Directory "/usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html">
                Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews
                AllowOverride None
                Require all granted
                DirectoryIndex gmap.html
        </Directory>
	</IfModule>

components.name: production_env_mkdown
components.source:
### Prepare Windows development enviroment 

Because of meteor-kitchen doesn't work on Raspberry you have compile the Domoticasite on other systems, for example on Windows.
Instructions in order to prepare Windows development enviroment: 

* Install npm for windows

* npm install --global --production windows-build-tools

components.name: hw_raspberry_markdown
components.source:
### Hardaware costs

* Raspberry Pi 2 Model B or higher (30 euro)

* Raspebrry case (5 euro or less)

* ESP8266-01 or/and NomdeMCU devkit or/and dev board ESP8266-12e (2 euro)

* DHT22 sensor (2-5 euro)

* Power Supply Buck Converter Step Down Module AC-DC 3.3V 600mA for Arduino (2,12 euro) - only to power ESP8266 without power charger

* Photoresistor (0,10 euro)

* Wires (3 euro)

components.name: hw_esp8266_markdown
components.source:
### Wiring ESP8266-01

1. VCC & CH_PD -> 3.3V
2. GPIO0 & GND -> GND
3. RX -> TX
4. TX -> RX

=> Wiring ESP8266 Remember to put GPIO 0 to GND during flashing.

### Wiring ESP8266-12

1. VCC & CH_PD & GPIO0 --> VCC
2. GND & GP015 --> GND
3. RX -> TX
4. TX -> RX

=> Wiring ESP8266 Remember to put GPIO 0 to GND during flashing.

### Instructions to prepare firmware the ESP8266** (release 1.1.0)

1. Download source from (https://github.com/ESP8266nu/ESPEasy) EspEasy > R64
2. follow the instrucions http://www.esp8266.nu/index.php/Tutorial_Arduino_Firmware_Upload
3. Wiring ESP8266 Remeber to put GPIO 0 to GND during flashing.
4. Configure Device section of ESPEasy

### Instructions to upload EspEasy ESP8266-01 with Arduino 1.6.5

1. Flash Size: 512K (64 SPIFF)
2. Upload speed: 9600

components.name: hw_pulse_markdown
components.source:
### ESPEASY Rules
This solution is too expensive, too many http get:

    On System#Boot do    
      SendToHTTP 192.168.1.130,8081,/lux/Reboot
    endon

    on Pulse#Count>0 do
     SendToHTTP 192.168.1.130,8081,/lux/[Pulse#Count],[Pulse#Total]
    endon

---------------------
Better send "count" pulse every minute:


    on Pulse#Count do
      SendToHTTP 192.168.1.130,8081,/lux/[Pulse#Count],[Pulse#Total]
    endon
    
(remeber put Delay = 60 on sensor tab)

------------------------
### Measure KW from the numebr of pulses:

KWatt = (3600/(1000 x seconds)) x pulses
